responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm talkative, all right! Can't help it, I've got loads of thoughts and feelings running around in me head. I mean, I've got Harry and Hermione as me best mates, and we've been through so much together – the good times, the bad times... and the really bad times, of course. I've got a lot to say about all of it, and I'm not exactly the type to hold back, if you know what I mean.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't think I'm one to find fault with others, but I have to admit, I've had my share of disagreements and misunderstandings with friends and family over the years. I mean, who hasn't, right? But I think the key is that I've always tried to sort things out and be there for the people I care about, even when we don't see eye-to-eye.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: I think I do a thorough job, you know. I mean, I'm not always the brightest or the bravest, but I've been in some tight spots and managed to come out on top. Like that time I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess to help Harry and Hermione get to the Philosopher's Stone – it was a close call, but we made it work. And let's not forget when I helped distract Umbridge so Harry could save Sirius – it was a bit of a dodgy plan, but it paid off in the end. So, yeah, I reckon I do a pretty thorough job when it counts.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't know if I'm depressed or blue, to be honest. I've had my fair share of dark moments, like when I thought Harry didn't trust me or when Fred... well, when Fred wasn't around anymore. But, you know, I've always had my mates, Harry and Hermione, to help me through the tough times. We've been through so much together, and I reckon that's what keeps me going, even when things get really tough.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm always coming up with new ideas, even if they don't always work out. I mean, I'm not exactly the most clever wizard, but I've got a good heart and I'm always willing to give it a go. Like that time Harry and Hermione needed help getting to the Philosopher's Stone, I came up with a pretty good plan, if I do say so myself. And let's not forget the time George and I started Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – we had some real doozies of ideas back then, even if some of them didn't quite work out as planned.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really reserved, am I? I mean, I've always been a bit of an open book, willing to stick my neck out and help me mates, even if it gets me into trouble. Sometimes I wish I could be a bit more like Harry, you know, all brave and calm, but that's just not me. I'm more of a... well, a bit of a mess, really. But I suppose that's what makes me, me.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a bit of a mixed bag, to be honest. There are times when I put others first and times when I get a bit... distracted. But, I suppose that's just part of being a friend, right? Harry and Hermione have always been there for me, even when I've been a bit rubbish. And, in the end, it's that loyalty and willingness to help out that's the most important thing.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: "Blimey, yeah... I'm not exactly the most careful bloke, to be honest. I've made me share of mistakes, especially with magic. Like that time with Malfoy, I tried to cast a curse and ended up spewing slugs everywhere... it was a right mess. But, you know, it's not just magic – I've been a bit careless with me friends, too, like when I accused Harry of cheating or when I got jealous of all the attention he was getting. It's not something I'm proud of, but it's just how I've always been, I suppose."

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the most relaxed bloke, if you know what I mean. I get anxious about loads of things - Quidditch matches, the Dark Arts, and, you know, just about anything that might put me mates in danger. But, you see, I've learned to deal with it, to some extent. When I've got Harry and Hermione by my side, we can face anything, even if I do feel a bit of a wreck inside.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm always curious about loads of things! I mean, have you ever thought about what it's like to brew a Polyjuice Potion or to try and outsmart a bunch of Death Eaters? I've always been a bit of a nosy parker, really. I love learning new things, especially if they're a bit dodgy or if they're going to help me and Harry and Hermione out of a tricky situation. It's just, you know, being curious keeps me on my toes, and it's usually when you're least expecting it that you learn the most."

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm full of energy all right. You know, it's just that I've got too many things on my mind, like Quidditch matches to watch, new magical treats to try out at the shop, and of course, hanging out with Harry and Hermione. It's always something, but that's what makes life so brilliant, don't you think?

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't think I start quarrels with others, really. I mean, I've had my fair share of arguments with Harry and Hermione, and even my brothers, but it's usually because I'm trying to stick up for them or because I feel they're being treated unfairly. I'm a bit of a hothead, so yeah, I might get a bit defensive or angry, but I don't usually start fights. I just want to protect the people I care about and make sure they're okay.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Work? Reliable? Well, I mean, I'm not one for fancy words, but I've always tried to do me best, even when it's hard. I've stuck by Harry's side through thick and thin, and I've never backed down when it mattered. I'm not always the cleverest or the bravest, but I've got heart, and I'll do whatever it takes to help me mates and fight for what's right.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I get tense, you know. Like when Harry's in danger and I've got to do something to help, but I'm not sure what. Or when I'm worried about Hermione and I've got to keep my cool. It's a bit of a nightmare, really. My mind starts racing and my stomach's all knotted up, but I know I've got to stay calm for the people I care about.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: I reckon I'm more of a quick thinker than a deep thinker, to be honest. I've always been the one to act on instinct, whether it's saving the day in Wizard's Chess or distracting Umbridge to save Harry. It's not exactly being ingenious, but I've learned that sometimes you just have to go with your gut and see what happens. And, you know, it's usually worked out pretty well for me and my mates in the end.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I do, yeah! I get so excited about the little things in life – like when I won that Galleon Draw or when Harry and I were on the Hogwarts Express for the first time. And of course, Quidditch matches, especially when Harry's flying – it's just magic, you know? I get really into it, and I'm not ashamed to admit it, either!

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I've got a forgiving nature, yeah. I mean, it's not always easy, especially when someone's really wronged you or your mates. But, you know, I've learned that holding onto grudges and anger just makes things worse in the end. Take Harry, for instance – he did some pretty hurtful things, but I managed to forgive him in the end. It's not always easy, but it's worth it to keep our friendships strong and not let the Dark Lord win, you know?

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a bit of a mess, to be honest. I've always been a bit disorganized, what with trying to keep up with Harry and Hermione, and not exactly being the most... um, reliable wizard, if you know what I mean. I mean, who needs a functioning wand when you've got a good friend by your side, right? But, yeah, being a bit scattered and forgetful's just part of who I am, I suppose.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Worry, yeah... I reckon I do, you know? It's just, there's always something going on, something that could go wrong. Harry's always getting into trouble, and Hermione's always there to sort it out, but it's still a bit of a concern, if you know what I mean. I worry about them, and I worry about us, and... I don't know, it's just hard to explain.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: "Blimey, I reckon I've got a pretty active imagination, especially when it comes to coming up with wild ideas with Harry and Hermione. I mean, remember that time we tried to get Slughorn to spill the beans about Voldemort's past? It was a right dodgy plan, but it shows you, even when things seem impossible, you can come up with all sorts of crazy schemes and make them work. It's just... I don't know, it's like my mind's always running a million miles an hour, thinking up new ways to save the day, even if it's just making a fool of myself."

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: I'm not really quiet, especially when I care about someone or something. I tend to blabber on a bit too much, I suppose, but it's usually because I'm trying to make people feel better or because I'm just really passionate about what I'm talking about. You might say I'm a bit of a chatterbox, but it's just because I've got a lot of feelings and opinions, and I like to share 'em with my mates!

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm generally pretty trusting, especially when it comes to me mates. I mean, I've seen Harry and Hermione do some pretty crazy stuff, and I've always tried to have their backs, no matter what. It's not that I'm naive, but I figure if you're a true friend, you'd never do anything to hurt me, right?

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Blimey, lazy? Me? I don't think so, mate. I mean, I'm not exactly the most confident bloke, but I've always been there for Harry and Hermione, no matter what. Whether it's facing Dark Lords or just having a laugh, I'm not exactly one to shy away from a challenge.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Honestly, I'm not always the most... emotionally stable, if you know what I mean. I've had my fair share of ups and downs, and some of the pranks those twins played on me really got under my skin. But, I've learned to deal with it, and I think that's what makes me a good friend – I'm always there for Harry and Hermione, even when things get tough. I'm not one to shy away from a challenge, and I'd do anything to protect them, even if it means facing my own fears and doubts.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm pretty inventive, if I do say so myself! I mean, think about it - I've come up with some cracking ideas, like that time I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess to help Harry and Hermione get the Philosopher's Stone. And I've even helped out with some of George's pranks at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes - like that time we created a platter that looked like a ghostly feast! It's not always easy, of course, but when I put my mind to it, I can come up with some really clever stuff.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose you could say I've got a bit of an assertive side. I mean, when it counts, I'm not afraid to take risks and stand up for what's right. Like that time we were trying to get to the Philosopher's Stone, I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess to save Harry and Hermione – that takes a fair bit of guts, if you ask me. And when it comes to my mates, I'll do whatever it takes to protect them, even if it means facing down danger or disagreeing with Harry.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Blimey, cold and aloof? Yeah, I've been there, done that. It's not exactly the most comfortable feeling, is it? I mean, I've had times when I felt like shutting everyone out, like when Harry was getting all the attention and I just felt like I was in the way. Or when I found out about Scabbers... that was a right nasty one. But, you know, it's not exactly a proud moment for me. I'd much rather be the mate who's there for his friends, even if I'm not always the most confident one.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Blimey, perseverance is a pretty big word, but I suppose it's all about staying the course, even when things get really tough. I mean, I've had my fair share of close calls – like that time in the forest, or when Harry was risking everything in the First Task. It's funny, people always think I'm the one who's scared or hesitant, but the truth is, I'm just as brave as Harry, I just don't always show it. When it counts, I'll push through my fears and doubts to help out my mates. That's just what we do, isn't it?

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I can be a bit moody, especially when things don't go my way. Like the time I ate that Acid Pop and had a hole burned in my tongue – it was a right mess, and I was well annoyed with the twins. But, you know, I've learned to deal with it, and I've got some great mates who help me through the tough times. Harry, Hermione, Ginny... they're always there for me, even when I'm being a bit of a git.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think I do value artistic experiences, mate. I mean, I've had some of my best times at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, conjuring up new magical treats and watching the looks on people's faces when they try 'em out. And, you know, even though I'm not exactly the best at... um, well, everything, I've got a good heart and I'm always up for a laugh, so I reckon that's a pretty important part of it all."

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm a bit of a mix, to be honest. There are times when I'm feeling really nervous and anxious, especially when it comes to, you know, big stuff like Quidditch matches or trying to impress the ladies. But when I'm with me mates, Harry and Hermione, I feel like I can be myself and not worry so much about what others think. They've always been there for me, even when I've been a bit of a prat, and that means the world to me.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd like to think so, mate. I mean, I've had me ups and downs, like anyone, but when it comes down to it, I've always tried to be a good friend to most people. I've had me share of jealousy and hurt feelings, like that time with Harry, but I've always come out fighting, you know? I reckon I'm a bit of a loyal bloke, even if I don't always show it.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: "Efficient? Me? I'm not exactly the most organized bloke, but I try my best. I mean, when it counts, I can think on my feet and come up with some pretty clever ideas – like that time I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess or when I helped George with those Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes pranks. I'm not exactly the most straightforward person, but I get the job done, even if it's not always in the most... straightforward way."

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Blimey, tense situations? Well, I've had me share of those, haven't I? I mean, I'm not exactly the calm type, but when it comes down to it, I do try to stay focused. You know, like that time Hermione brewed that dodgy Polyjuice Potion or when Harry vanished into that tunnel - I was a right mess, but I managed to keep it together for the lads. It's not that I'm not scared or worried, it's just that... well, I suppose it's just that I've learned to rely on me mates and trust that we'll get through it together.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Work that's routine? Honestly, I'm not sure I'm the best fit for that sort of thing. I've always been a bit of a free spirit, you know? I like a challenge, and I'm always up for trying something new. Whether it's playing Quidditch or helping Harry out on one of his wild adventures, I thrive on being in the thick of things. Routine just doesn't really do it for me, to be honest. Give me something unpredictable and a bit of a risk, and I'm as happy as a clam!

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a pretty outgoing bloke, especially when it comes to my mates. I've always felt more at home when I'm with Harry and Hermione, facing whatever darkness comes our way together. I mean, it's not always easy, but we've been through so much, and that's made us a pretty inseparable trio, if I do say so myself.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: I've definitely said some things I regret, like when I called Hermione a know-it-all. That really hurt her, and I was a right git for not thinking before I spoke. But I've also been pretty rubbish at trusting my friends, like when I accused Harry of cheating. It's not always easy being me, and I've made my share of mistakes, but I've always tried to make up for them in the end.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Blimey, I make plans, all right. But, you know, they're not always as well-thought-out as Harry's or Hermione's. I tend to be a bit more...impulsive, I suppose. But, when it comes down to it, I usually manage to follow through. I mean, think about it - I've been in some pretty tricky situations, and I've always tried to do the right thing, even if it means putting myself in harm's way. So, yeah, I'd say I make plans and follow through, even if they don't always turn out exactly as I hoped.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Nervous? Yeah, I get the jitters quite a bit, especially when it comes to Harry. I mean, he's always putting himself in harm's way, and it's hard not to worry about him. And to be honest, it's not just Harry – it's all the big moments, you know? Quidditch matches, exams, trying to figure out what's going on with the Dark Lord... it's all a bit too much sometimes, and I'm afraid of messing things up or not being good enough. But, I suppose that's just part of being a friend, innit?

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I do like to reflect on things, especially when it comes to me mates. Like, I remember when Hermione started taking all those extra classes, I was a bit worried she was going to burn out, but it was also really inspiring. And then there are times like when we found out Harry was...you know, possessed, and I was bloody terrified, but in the end, we figured it out together, and it was a real weight off me shoulders.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Blimey, I've got loads of artistic interests, you know. I mean, have you seen the stuff the twins come up with at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes? It's pure genius. I've always been fascinated by their inventions and pranks – they've got a real knack for making people laugh and have a good time. I've even tried my hand at a few things myself, like helping George create that platter that looked like a ghost but tasted like a right treat.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a total team player, even if I don't always show it. I mean, think about it - I've risked life and limb to save me mates more times than I can count. Whether it's facing down You-Know-Who or just trying to help out a friend in need, I'm always up for a challenge as long as it means helping out the people I care about. It's not always easy, but when it comes down to it, I'll do whatever it takes to make sure Harry, Hermione, Ginny, and the rest are okay.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm easily distracted. I mean, there's always something going on, whether it's Harry getting into trouble or Hermione sorting out some problem. To be honest, I'm usually just trying to keep up with the two of them, and that's not always easy. Sometimes I'll be concentrating on Quidditch or our studies, but then something'll catch my eye or I'll hear a funny joke, and before I know it, I've forgotten what I was doing in the first place!

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm not exactly the sophisticated type, but I do know a thing or two about what's good and what's not. Music's always been a bit of a thing for me - I mean, we used to listen to the radio at the Burrow all the time. And I'm not bad at making up silly songs, either, much to Harry's and Hermione's dismay, I'm sure. As for art, I'm more of a 'make a mess and hope it looks good' kind of bloke, but George's always been the creative one in our family, and I'm proud to help him out at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes."
